TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridViewLinkCell extends System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell

Docs.summary: Represents a cell that contains a link.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataGridViewLinkCell class is a specialized type of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> used to display links.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn> is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type. By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is initialized to a new DataGridViewLinkCell. To pattern the cells within a column after an existing DataGridViewLinkCell, set the column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.CellTemplate%2A> property to the cell to use as a pattern.
The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell. Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change. Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> as a template for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn>. Style changes made to any cell in the column affect all of the column's cells. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ButtonDemos#120](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.d_97_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ButtonDemos#120](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.d_97_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ButtonDemos#120](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.d_97_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the color used to display an active link.
Docs.value: A that represents the color used to display a link that is being selected. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the color of links in the hover state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.ActiveLinkColor%2A> property of the owning column also sets the ActiveLinkColor property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.ActiveLinkColor%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you do not explicitly call the CreateAccessibilityInstance method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.DataGridViewLinkCellAccessibleObject> property is referenced.
> [!NOTE] > To get or set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.AccessibilityObject%2A>, you must add a reference to the `Accessibility` assembly installed with the .NET Framework.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the cell's hosted editing control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks As implemented in this class, this property always returns `null` because a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell> cannot be edited.

Docs.summary: Gets the display of the cell value.
Docs.value: The display of the cell value.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValueType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine the type of the cell contents. In this example, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValueType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is used to determine whether the cell contains a <xref:System.String> before attempting to convert the value. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override bool KeyUpUnsharesRow (System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e, int rowIndex);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool KeyUpUnsharesRow(class System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e, int32 rowIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains data about the key press.
The index of the row containing the cell.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the row containing the cell will be unshared when a key is released and the cell has focus.
Docs.returns: if the SPACE key was released, the property is , the property is , and the CTRL, ALT, and SHIFT keys are not pressed; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks KeyUpUnsharesRow is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnKeyUp%2A>. It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.OnKeyUp%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row containing the cell. It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](../Topic/Best%20Practices%20for%20Scaling%20the%20Windows%20Forms%20DataGridView%20Control.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the behavior of a link.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Examples of link behavior include whether the link always displays an underline or the link only displays an underline when the mouse pointer moves over it, and whether a double click or a single click activates a link.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.LinkBehavior%2A> property of the owning column also sets the LinkBehavior property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.LinkBehavior%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#70](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.d_372_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#70](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.d_372_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#70](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.d_372_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The specified value when setting this property is not a valid value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the color used to display an inactive and unvisited link.
Docs.value: A that represents the color used to initially display a link. The default value is the user's Internet Explorer setting for the link color.

remarks.format:

To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.LinkColor%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the link was visited.
Docs.value: if the link has been visited; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.TrackVisitedState%2A> property is set to `true`, the LinkVisited property is automatically set when the link is visited.
A link is visited if it has been activated by selecting it with the mouse or keyboard.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the link changes color when it is visited.
Docs.value: if the link changes color when it is selected; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkCell.LinkVisited%2A> property will not be automatically set to `true` when visited.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.TrackVisitedState%2A> property of the owning column also sets the TrackVisitedState property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewLinkColumn.TrackVisitedState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
